intro: Chamaesyce vaginulata, commonly known as the velvetleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its common name. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Chamaesyce vaginulata is often found in rocky areas and along roadsides, where it adapts well to harsh conditions.
